status_effects.description: A collection of all status effects in the game, defining their properties, behaviors, and visual effects.

added_vfx.description: Reference to the VFX played when the status effect is added.

additional_trigger_stages.description: Additional stages when the status effect can trigger. Controls when the game calls TestTrigger/OnTriggered on your status effect class.

affected_vfx.description: Reference to the VFX played on the affected target.

allow_secondary_tooltip_placement.description: Whether to allow secondary tooltip placement.

allow_secondary_ui_placement.description: Whether to allow secondary UI placement.

applied_sfx.description: Reference to the sound effect played when the status is applied.

card_tooltips.description: Tooltip text describing the status effect when mousing over a card.

character_tooltips.description: Tooltip text describing the status effect when mousing over a character that has had the status applied to it.

class_name.description: String specifying the class name associated with this status effect. The class must exist in your Plugin and must inherit from StatusEffectState.

display_category.description: Category for displaying the status effect.

exclude_hero_propagation.description: Whether to exclude hero propagation (ex. Dazed).

hidden.description: Whether to hide the icon and tooltip of this status effect.

icon.description: From section sprites, must reference the id of a sprite sized 24x24 that has a transparent background and white. For display in tooltips an atlas_sprite must be given (with the same ID) a black and white image of the same size.

id.description: The statusID of your status effect, this needs to be a lowercase and unique string. In your StatusEffectState subclass the statusId must be set to {modguid}-statuseffect-{id} as a lowercase string.

is_propagatable.description: Whether the status effect can propagate (friendly units increase buffs, enemy units increase debuffs).

is_stackable.description: Whether the status effect can stack.

more_added_vfx.description: Additional VFX to play when the status is added.

more_removed_vfx.description: Additional VFX to play when the status is removed.

more_triggered_vfx.description: Additional VFX to play when the status is triggered.

names.description: Used when the status effect is nonstackable. The text that displays when applied on a card.

remove_at_end_of_turn.description: Whether to remove the status effect at the end of turn.

remove_at_end_of_turn_after_post_combat.description: Whether to remove the status effect after post combat.

remove_at_end_of_turn_when_triggered.description: Whether to remove the status effect at the end of turn when triggered.

remove_stack_at_end_of_turn.description: Whether to remove a stack at the end of turn.

remove_when_triggered.description: Whether to remove the status effect when triggered.

remove_when_triggered_after_card_played.description: Whether to remove the status effect when triggered after a card is played.

removed_vfx.description: Reference to the VFX played when the status effect is removed.

replacement_texts.description: If provided, creates a replacement text of [modguid_statusId] for use in tooltip text and descriptions. This should be the status effect name within a bold tag. (ex. Rage).

scales_in_endless.description: Whether the status effect scales in endless mode.

show_notifications_on_removal.description: Whether to show notifications when the status effect is removed.

show_on_pyre_heart.description: Whether to show the status effect on the pyre heart.

show_stack_count.description: Whether to show the stack count, set to false if is_stackable is set to false.

stackable_names.description: Used when the status effect is stackable. The text that displays when applied on a card. Usually <nobr>NameOfStatusEffect {0}</nobr>

trigger_stage.description: Controls when the game calls TestTrigger/OnTriggered on your status effect class.

triggered_sfx.description: Reference to the sound effect played when the status is triggered.

triggered_vfx.description: Reference to the VFX played when the status is triggered.

items.description: A status effect definition that specifies the properties, behaviors, and visual effects of a status effect that can be applied to characters or cards.
